responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability
    analysis: |
      The application appears to be rendering user-supplied input without properly sanitizing it, potentially allowing attackers to inject malicious scripts into web pages viewed by other users. This could enable attackers to perform various attacks like stealing user sessions, defacing the website, and potentially executing arbitrary code on the client-side.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - AnsibleTowerStep
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/ansible_tower/AnsibleTowerStep.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Potential code injection vulnerability
    analysis: |
      The application appears to be using external, user-supplied input to construct commands or code that are then executed, without properly sanitizing the input. This could potentially allow an attacker to inject and execute arbitrary code.
    cwe: CWE-94
    function_names:
      - submitTemplate
      - rawLookupByString
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/ansible_tower/util/TowerConnector.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Improper input validation
    analysis: |
      Some user input fields, such as job template names, inventory names, and credential names, do not appear to have proper validation to prevent potential injection attacks or path traversal attacks. An attacker could potentially supply crafted input to exploit these vulnerabilities.
    cwe: CWE-20
    function_names:
      - getJobTemplate
      - rawLookupByString
      - submitTemplate
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/ansible_tower/util/TowerConnector.java
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Potential path traversal vulnerability
    analysis: |
      The application appears to be constructing file paths using user-supplied input, without properly sanitizing or validating the input. An attacker could potentially supply crafted input to access or modify files outside the intended directory.
    cwe: CWE-22
    function_names:
      - getConfigFile
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/ansible_tower/AnsibleTowerGlobalConfig.java
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability
leads.analysis: The application appears to be rendering user-supplied input without properly sanitizing it, potentially allowing attackers to inject malicious scripts into web pages viewed by other users. This could enable attackers to perform various attacks like stealing user sessions, defacing the website, and potentially executing arbitrary code on the client-side.

leads.headline: Potential code injection vulnerability
leads.analysis: The application appears to be using external, user-supplied input to construct commands or code that are then executed, without properly sanitizing the input. This could potentially allow an attacker to inject and execute arbitrary code.

leads.headline: Improper input validation
leads.analysis: Some user input fields, such as job template names, inventory names, and credential names, do not appear to have proper validation to prevent potential injection attacks or path traversal attacks. An attacker could potentially supply crafted input to exploit these vulnerabilities.

leads.headline: Potential path traversal vulnerability
leads.analysis: The application appears to be constructing file paths using user-supplied input, without properly sanitizing or validating the input. An attacker could potentially supply crafted input to access or modify files outside the intended directory.
